Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of raising tax rates on small business owners by stating that "more than half of them are small business owners."
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that "more than half of the wealthiest Americans are small business owners."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that raising tax rates on the wealthiest Americans will directly impact small business owners and their ability to create jobs, without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that may contribute to the effects of raising tax rates on small business owners.
